alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 12:05AM MDT until June 22 at 1:03PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Homeless encampment below and near the Nevada Avenue bridge is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.3 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early this morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 09/02/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Fountain Creek Colorado Spring 11.5 7.1 Wed 11 pm MD 7.8 MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.
